reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Terrala basically because we didn't want to stay in one of the 'very high rise blocks', this was not on the agenda at all !.
reviews.title: good experience in all ways

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We proved the Terralta was the right choice,good value for money,bright,clean and spacious apartment. Because of the hill where the property is situated we didn't go out in the evenings but ate in the perfectly adequate bar/restaurant. Although buses run every hour its not what you would say was a pleasant experience waiting around. Being early in the year there were very few people staying in the Terralta but all the facilities were available to use apart from the Entertainment programme,not enough guests to operate Bingo etc.and no children for the childrens mini club etc. The pool looked very inviting but no one used it as far as we could see, not enough guests which was a shame because everything was geared up to provide an excellent stay for all ages,could see how popular it would be in the Summer months.
reviews.title: Lovely apartments

reviews.text: The Reception staff were all very helpful and spoke very good english,the bar staff were all very pleasant and accommodating.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay.

reviews.text: All in all,if we went to Benidorm again we would stay at the Terralta again.Very relaxing and away from it all !
reviews.title: would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our 3rd stay here, the rooms are very clean with everythings you need. The staff are very helpful and friendly. I image that in the hot weather it would be just perfect sitting by the very large swimming pool (we stayed in February) sunbathing and swimming.
reviews.title: Deep in the heart of nowhere

reviews.text: Large, Clean Apartments 5* - booked to go back in May 2012, would recommend for families with small children.
reviews.title: Large, Clean Apartments 5* - booked to go back

reviews.text: I stayed here for the first time early last octpber. Family had stayed before and recommended it for our first Family holiday that included myself, partner and our toddler. I was really nervous as the last time we stayed in benidorm we stayed at primavera park and it was nothing short of filthy. Well i neednt have worried as on arrival we were greeted by polite staff and shown to our room immediatey which was immaculately clean and tidy with plenty of space for the three of us. The pool area was just as impressivee cleaned every night, large with plenty of loungers and a little play park. There is a steep hill separting the apartment frm the nearest store and a brave walk into the centre of benidorm. But there is buses hourly from right outside the apts and again coming back so u are able to avoid it. There is a small shop on site for bits n bobs too. In all i thought these apartments really gave the family holiday feel i was looking for. We loved them so much we r set to return this september.
reviews.title: Excellent apartments ideal for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Benidorm so chose these apartments as they were not in a noisy area and we were not disappointed. Check in was quick and we were given a ground floor pool view apt which was clean and spacious . The staff are friendly and bar area and pool well maintained. It took us 10 mins to walk to poniente beach - slightly longer to walk back up the hill but when out in the evening we generally got a taxi back which costs around 7 euro- might be slightly more depending on whether you venture into new town. The hill is not too steep but by the end of the week becomes a bit boring and I think would be too much for elderly or disabled people. Would definitely stay here again .
reviews.title: Comfortable spacious apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second visit to Terralta Apts this year. The apartments are lovely, clean and well maintained and all the staff at the apartments are brilliant, especially the bar staff who are so friendly. The food served in the bar is really good and very reasonably priced and caters for the English. Happy hour is for an hour and a half in the bar for local drinks and from 8.30 to 10pm. They have a lovely outdoor pool and lots of sun loungers to sit around, and when its too cold for outdoor pool they also have an indoor one which is heated. My partner and I used the steam room most days at a cost of 3 euro each for an hour. You have to book through reception and you have it to yourself for the hour.
reviews.title: First class apartments and would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is only one downside to these apartments, and that is the huge hill to get up to them. Not a problem if your half way fit, but would definately be a problem for elderly or disabled. Personally I think the hike up the hill now and again is well worth it for such a great place to stay in Benidorm.
reviews.title: great out of town location

reviews.text: I have just returned from a short trip at the Terralta apartments. We booked here because other people have said they were clean, good for families with children and in a quieter part of Benidorm.
reviews.title: GOOD VALUE APARTMENTS IN A QUIETER PART OF BENIDORM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartments are approx 20 minutes walk from Poniente beach, which is the quieter beach in the more Spanish and residential area of Benidorm. There is not much choice of places to eat or bars nearby.
reviews.title: Good apartments

reviews.text: Levante beach is about 15 mins drive away and is busy and more English than Poniente and has many more places to eat and drink in the evenings.
reviews.title: now for the bad points

reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bed apartment and put our 21 month old in the 2nd bedroom in a cot. The cot was a bit rickety and the mattress didn't fit very well and had big gaps around the outside. I had taken my own sheets, so I filled in the gaps with hotel provided towels and put my sheet over the top. Not the safest cot I have ever seen, but it worked out ok.
reviews.title: Lovely place.

reviews.text: The bed was quite firm, a little too firm for me
reviews.title: great apartments

reviews.text: Yes the terralta appartments are a little bit away from the main benidorm action,but 10 mins walk and you,re on the beach.Benidorm can be lively but what a great place to relax if thats what you want.We went with a group of friends (7)and they all loved it too.Friendly staff,lovely pools,reasonable bar prices(especially happy hour),comfortable appartments.If you like to be nosey then 15 euros extra per apparment is well worth it for a pool view,sky sports is also 10 euro extra for your room.There is a hill to walk back up to the complex,but not too steep,helps burn off those extra calories.We,ve been before and cant wait to all go again.Please dont go to Benidorm without going to Benidorm palace....a brilliant night out...happy hols
reviews.title: lovely out of town,but comfortable,friendly,great value

reviews.text: Booked through Travel Republic, got a great deal. Travelled with 2 friends for long weekend away. Had never been to Benidorm before so didn't know what to expect - Terralta did not disappoint - we knew it was a little out of the way, but we didn't want to be totally in the middle of the hussle and bussle but near enough when we wanted to party. The pool is great (was abit cold but it was beg Oct - though the weather was fantastic), apartment was very clean, big and well equipped - massive balconey and I found the beds very comfy - even the sofa's (which turned into bed when the backing pillows taken off) were big and comfortable. We only at once at the hotel, lunch was ok, so can't comment too much about that. Reception staff very helpful and honestly could not fault this place, I would return definately. Took about 15 minutes walk down into the Old Town (which is lovely, great shopping, lovely atmosphere) - another 15 minutes stroll along the beach and your in the lively new town - it's buzzing and we did have some great meals and lots of shows, bars etc. Chinese buffet was great - can't remember the name of the restaurant but it was only 4.50 Euro's for 3 course meal and half bottle of wine! Enjoyed cocktails at the Comedy Club too. The Terralta was great for what we wanted - a relaxing girls weekend, good base for shopping and near enough to the resort we could walk to or hop into a taxi (9 Euro), not too long transfer from the airport and clean and comfortable apartment with friendly staff.
reviews.title: TERRALTA WAS RECOMMENDED TO ME, I WOULD RECOMMEND

reviews.text: Visited here in mid October, 2 adults 2 kids, The apartments were large enough for a family of 4. Clean and tidy and well maintained. Air conditioning was working and came on every 2 hours or so. The pool was big clean but as it was October it was a bit chilly, but the kids went storming in any way!!!. We went self catering so went to the small supermarket in the complex. Prices were higher than the ones down the street but it was ok to get some essentials till we found our feet (bread, milk, butter). We had breakfast a few times but found it to be expensive, about 25euros, so we bought food and cerial and cooked breakfast and lunch in the apartments saving a lot of cash, which freed up cash for dinners both in the restraunt both in the hotel and other outside places. The hill is not a massive climb but a wee incline that should be easy for most people. A bus runs from right outside and is every hour on the hour and costs 1.35euros and takes you right into the heart of benidorm and can drop you off near the "British Strip". The nearest supermarket is a walk down the hill, (staying on the same side as the apartments) about 400m away and prices are a lot cheaper than the in-store supermarket, I stocked up with a few bottles of San Miguel and Amstel. The bar prices are reasonable and when your at the pool its nice to sup a cold one while enjoying the sun. Happy hour is from 9pm-10:30, and is a very good deal 2 for 1. One thing we were not too impressed with was the "Reptile show", 3 people came along with 4 big boxes, pulled out some snakes to show the audience, walked around, let them feel the snake, then it was back in the box. They pulled out a massive albino python and asked if anyone wanted a photo, a lot of people said yes, they started putting snakes around everyone and started taking photos. I asked a few times how much and eventually found it was 20EUROS!!!! No way was i paying that. It became clear they were on a money making exercise. Be warned folks.
reviews.title: First time in Benidorm

reviews.text: Apart from that they had good entertainment on every night, which coincided with the Happy hour. We visited Benidorm Circus which not a lot of people mention but is a good night out, (its behind the Benidorm Palace). We also visited "Morgans Tavern" which is in the series Benidorm, a bit expensive but the entertainment is free and well done. Along from Morgans is the Irish Bar "The Shamrock" a good place for a sing song along with the band "Rovers". This is just along the road from the British corner. Choose from a host of british bars. All in all id recommend the Terralta as a good place for a family. We'll prob go back next year.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: prices were: Chicken nugget and chips= 4.50e, Fish and chips 7.00e, Spag bol 4.90e, soup 2.50e, grilled sirloin 12.50e.
reviews.title: Amazing Value For Money
